issue.title: Unable to spawn robots in Ignition

content.raw:
So I can’t reproduce your issue but I do know how you make a work-around to spawn in the mean time. It appears you may have caught an intermittent commit as changes did not percolate throughout all of the world files.

To fix X1 spawning in the Virtual STIX environment with a model name such as “X1 UGV” you need to go into subt/subt\_ign/launch/<world\_name>.ign \(i.e. virtual\_stix.ign in this case\) and look around line # 347 and modify the line:

> <uri>[https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/1.0/openrobotics/models/X1](https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/1.0/openrobotics/models/X1) Config #\{\_config\}</uri>\\n"\\

to be:

> <uri>[https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/1.0/openrobotics/models/X1](https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/1.0/openrobotics/models/X1) UGV Config #\{\_config\}</uri>\\n"\\

Where “X1 UGV Config #” is a valid model name in your models directory. If you wanted to use X2 you would have to do the same sort of modification. Please let me know if this doesn’t work for you.

Also can you try running another world \(i.e. tunnel\_practice\_#\) to see if it works out of the box there or you get the same problems?
content.html:
So I can’t reproduce your issue but I do know how you make a work-around to spawn in the mean time. It appears you may have caught an intermittent commit as changes did not percolate throughout all of the world files.

To fix X1 spawning in the Virtual STIX environment with a model name such as “X1 UGV” you need to go into subt/subt_ign/launch/<world_name>.ign (i.e. virtual_stix.ign in this case) and look around line # 347 and modify the line:

<uri>https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/1.0/openrobotics/models/X1 Config #{_config}</uri>\n"\

to be:

<uri>https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/1.0/openrobotics/models/X1 UGV Config #{_config}</uri>\n"\

Where “X1 UGV Config #” is a valid model name in your models directory. If you wanted to use X2 you would have to do the same sort of modification. Please let me know if this doesn’t work for you.

Also can you try running another world (i.e. tunnel_practice_#) to see if it works out of the box there or you get the same problems?
